TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509Certificate2Collection extends System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509CertificateCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> store is opened, the result is represented by an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. If you are familiar with the unmanaged Cryptographic API constructs, you can think of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> as a memory store of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, selects only valid certificates, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.
[!code-cpp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CPP/certselect.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CS/certselect.cs#1)] [!code-vb[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/VB/certselect.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object, which is unlike the other constructors that use certificate or collection information to create the object.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, selects only valid certificates, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.
[!code-cpp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CPP/certselect.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CS/certselect.cs#1)] [!code-vb[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/VB/certselect.vb#1)]

Public Function Add (certificate As X509Certificate2) As Integer

Docs.param: An X.509 certificate represented as an object.
Docs.summary: Adds an object to the end of the .
Docs.returns: The index at which the has been added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method adds an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> object to a collection and returns the index location of the certificate.
## Examples The following code example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Adds multiple objects to an object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2[] certificates) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects.
Docs.summary: Adds multiple objects in an array to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method if you have an array of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects to add to an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection certificates) cil managed

Docs.param: An object.
Docs.summary: Adds multiple objects in an object to another object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method if you have certificates in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object that you want to add to another <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate) cil managed
Public Function Contains (certificate As X509Certificate2) As Boolean

Docs.param: The object to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the object contains a specific certificate.
Docs.returns: if the contains the specified ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property. That is, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
This method determines equality by calling the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

Docs.summary: Exports X.509 certificate information based on content type into a byte array.

Public Function Export (contentType As X509ContentType) As Byte()

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A supported object.
Docs.summary: Exports X.509 certificate information into a byte array.
Docs.returns: X.509 certificate information in a byte array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method supports content types that do not require a password.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] Export (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType contentType, string password);
.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] Export(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType contentType, string password) cil managed
Public Function Export (contentType As X509ContentType, password As String) As Byte()

Docs.param: A supported object.
A string used to protect the byte array.
Docs.summary: Exports X.509 certificate information into a byte array using a password.
Docs.returns: X.509 certificate information in a byte array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Cert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedCert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pfx>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedStore>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pkcs7>

Docs.exception: The certificate is unreadable, the content is invalid or, in the case of a certificate requiring a password, the private key could not be exported because the password provided was incorrect.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection Find (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType findType, object findValue, bool validOnly);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection Find(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType findType, object findValue, bool validOnly) cil managed
Public Function Find (findType As X509FindType, findValue As Object, validOnly As Boolean) As X509Certificate2Collection

public: System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2Collection ^ Find(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509FindType findType, System::Object ^ findValue, bool validOnly);

Attribute.AttributeName: System.MonoTODO("Does not support X509FindType.FindByTemplateName, FindByApplicationPolicy and FindByCertificatePolicy")

Docs.param: One of the values.
The search criteria as an object.
to allow only valid certificates to be returned from the search; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Searches an object using the search criteria specified by the enumeration and the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to find <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects if no user interaction is needed. Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.Find%2A> method to allow the user to select <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects.
Note that this method can be used in a cascading or nested style, narrowing the search criteria with each call to the method.
## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, finds only valid certificates, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.
[!code-cpp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CPP/certselect.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/CS/certselect.cs#1)] [!code-vb[certselect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CertSelect/VB/certselect.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through a object.
Docs.returns: An object that can iterate through the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Enumerators allow read-only access to data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

Docs.summary: Imports a certificate into a object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Import(unsigned int8[] rawData) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A byte array containing data from an X.509 certificate.
Docs.summary: Imports a certificate in the form of a byte array into a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method imports a certificate in the form of a byte array into a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Cert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedCert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pfx>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedStore>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pkcs7>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Authenticode>

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The name of the file containing the certificate information.
Docs.summary: Imports a certificate file into a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Cert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedCert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pfx>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedStore>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pkcs7>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Authenticode>

MemberSignature.Value: public void Import (byte[] rawData, string password, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags);
.method public hidebysig instance void Import(unsigned int8[] rawData, string password, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags) cil managed
Public Sub Import (rawData As Byte(), password As String, keyStorageFlags As X509KeyStorageFlags)
public: void Import(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ rawData, System::String ^ password, System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags);

Docs.param: A byte array containing data from an object.
The password required to access the certificate information.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that control how and where the certificate is imported.
Docs.summary: Imports a certificate, in the form of a byte array that requires a password to access the certificate, into a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be used with a PFX/PKCS12 binary large object (BLOB) protected by a password. Key containers associated with certificates in the PFX/PKCS12 BLOB can be created and the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags> value can be used to control this process. Note that if you do not create a key container, the private key is not persisted.
This method imports a certificate byte array into a collection of certificates. This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Cert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedCert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pfx>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedStore>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pkcs7>

MemberSignature.Value: public void Import (string fileName, string password, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags);
.method public hidebysig instance void Import(string fileName, string password, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags) cil managed
Public Sub Import (fileName As String, password As String, keyStorageFlags As X509KeyStorageFlags)
public: void Import(System::String ^ fileName, System::String ^ password, System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509KeyStorageFlags keyStorageFlags);

Docs.param: The name of the file containing the certificate information.
The password required to access the certificate information.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that control how and where the certificate is imported.
Docs.summary: Imports a certificate file that requires a password into a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be used with a PFX/PKCS12 file or other certificate files that require a password. Key containers associated with certificates in the PFX/PKCS12 file can be created and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509KeyStorageFlags> value can be used to control this process. Note that if you do not create a key container, the private key is not persisted.
Note that a PFX/PKCS12 file can contain more than one certificate. This method imports the first certificate associated with the private key or, if no private key is found, the first certificate found.
This method supports the following <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType> types:
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Cert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedCert>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pfx>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.SerializedStore>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Pkcs7>
- <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ContentType.Authenticode>

Public Sub Insert (index As Integer, certificate As X509Certificate2)

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which to insert .
The object to insert.
Docs.summary: Inserts an object into the object at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property already equals the capacity of the list, the capacity is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If `index` is equal to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>, `certificate` is added to the end of the collection.

## Examples The following code example opens the current user's personal certificate store, selects only valid certificates, allows the user to select a certificate, and then writes certificate and certificate chain information to the console. The output depends on the certificate the user selects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2[] certificates) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects.
Docs.summary: Removes multiple objects in an array from an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method if you have an array of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2> objects to remove from an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection certificates) cil managed

Docs.param: An object.
Docs.summary: Removes multiple objects in an object from another object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method if you have certificates in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object that you want to remove from another <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection> object. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection.RemoveRange%2A> methods process requests transactionally, so that if a single add or remove fails, the entire operation is aborted.
